name: The Great Flood
description: Because of widespread wickedness, God sent a global flood that destroyed all life except Noah's family and the animals on the ark. The flood lasted about one year.

name: The Call of Abraham
description: God called Abram to leave his homeland and go to a land He would show him. God promised to make Abram a great nation, bless him, and bless all nations through his offspring.

name: Exodus from Egypt
description: God delivered Israel from slavery in Egypt through ten plagues and parted the Red Sea. Moses led approximately 2-3 million Israelites out under God's protection.

name: Construction of the First Temple
description: King Solomon built the magnificent Temple in Jerusalem as a permanent dwelling place for God's presence among Israel. It took seven years to complete.

name: Creation
description: God created the heavens, earth, and all living things in six days, resting on the seventh. He made humanity (Adam and Eve) in His own image to rule over creation.

name: The Fall
description: Tempted by the serpent, Adam and Eve disobeyed God by eating the forbidden fruit. This introduced sin, shame, death, and separation from God into the human race.

name: The Dispersion of Nations (Tower of Babel)
description: Humanity built a tower to make a name for themselves and defy God. God confused their languages, causing them to scatter across the earth.

name: Ishmael Born
description: Abraham and Sarah, impatient for God's promise, had Abraham father a son through Hagar. Ishmael became the ancestor of many Arab peoples.

name: The Birth of Isaac
description: Sarah miraculously gave birth to Isaac when Abraham was 100 and she was 90. Isaac was the child of promise through whom God's covenant would continue.

name: The Twelve Tribes of Israel
description: The twelve sons of Jacob (Israel) by Leah, Rachel, Bilhah, and Zilpah became the ancestors of the twelve tribes of Israel.

name: Joseph's Exaltation in Egypt
description: Sold into slavery by his brothers, Joseph rose to become second-in-command in Egypt. He saved Egypt and his family from famine through God-given wisdom.

name: The Mosaic Covenant
description: At Mount Sinai, God gave the Ten Commandments and the Law to Israel through Moses. Israel agreed to obey God as His chosen people and treasured possession.

name: The Conquest of Canaan
description: Under Joshua's leadership, Israel conquered key cities and territories in Canaan. The land was divided among the twelve tribes.

name: Division of the Land
description: Joshua divided the conquered land among the twelve tribes of Israel by lot. Special cities of refuge and Levitical cities were also designated.

name: The Selection of King Saul
description: The people demanded a king like other nations. God chose Saul as Israel's first king through the prophet Samuel.

name: The Reign of King David
description: David, a man after God's own heart, united Israel, defeated its enemies, and established Jerusalem as the capital. He brought the Ark to Jerusalem.

name: The Division of the Kingdom
description: After Solomon's death, the kingdom split into the northern kingdom of Israel (10 tribes) and the southern kingdom of Judah (2 tribes) due to Rehoboam's harsh rule.

name: The Fall of the Northern Kingdom
description: Assyria conquered the northern kingdom of Israel, deported its people, and resettled the land with foreigners. This ended the northern kingdom.

name: Destruction of Jerusalem and Babylonian Captivity
description: King Nebuchadnezzar destroyed Jerusalem and the Temple and deported most of Judah. This began the 70-year exile prophesied by Jeremiah. The third deportation of Israelites to foreign countries took place.

name: The Return from Exile
description: Persian king Cyrus issued a decree allowing the Jews to return to Jerusalem and rebuild the Temple. About 50,000 returned under Zerubbabel.

name: The Dedication of the Second Temple
description: After returning from the Babylonian captivity, the Jewish people completed the reconstruction of the temple on March 12, 515 BC. Its dedication was a pivotal moment in preserving the nation's religious heritage and worship identity after 70 years of exile.

name: The Rebuilding of Jerusalem's Walls
description: Nehemiah led the effort to restore the city's dilapidated walls to protect the inhabitants from external threats and prevent assimilation into surrounding cultures. Despite intense opposition, the project was remarkably completed in 52 days.
